gov.usgs.anss.metadata

Class LoadURL

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.metadata.LoadURL

  • public class LoadURL
extends java.lang.Object
    This class uses FTP and HTTP to gather dataless volumes from originators. It uses the metadata.loadurl tables to track all of the URLs to visit and try to get metadata. Supported methods for getting metadata are "ftp:", "http:", and if the 'URL' includes the '.bash', then running a external script.

    If the switch "-iris" is used,
    1) the IRIS DMC is scanned for network volume files matching the name “??.dataless” where ?? is the two character FDSN network name. This avoids picking up temporary deployments and other garbage that is often in the directory.
    2) The system maintains the edge.loadurl table for all tags “NN-IRIS” (the filename must be “NN.dataless”) automatically. The automatic system scans the directory for files “NN.dataless” and if a new network data is found, it will create the loadurl table entry. All entries which include "-IRIS" in the name are skipped unless -iris mode is chosen.

    Note on IRIS mode - Users should never modify one of these NN-IRIS records other than to disable the load. Disabling is done because the metadata is gotten from some other source that is more reliable or quicker to post changes than the IRIS/DMC. For instance at the NEIC there is a US-IRIS that is disabled because the NEIC has its own FTP area where changes to metadata are posted as they are created. If you want to get some IRIS/DMC metadata that is not the normal network volume (say temp deployments), create a new loadurl entry with a tag like "??-DMC" or "??-2013" and get the volumes from the DMC by specific filename or wildcarded names. Sometimes IRIS splits up the network volumes because they have too many stations for a single volume (UW is an example). If this happens, the entry to get such split volumes must be done in their own tag as above. Always remember to disable the network volume when there is another tag to get the metadata.

    All entries from IRIS for split up or temp deployments must use the PASV mode in the URL. The NN-IRIS ones do not have this, but they are always fetched on the connections that runs IRIS mode which is always set to PASV.

    Whether or not -iris is used, all enabled entries in the loadurl table are scanned for new metadata. In such a pass the codes with "-IRIS" are skipped. That is all network dataless load from IRIS are done in -iris mode. Exception : the -where switch can be used to limit the loadurl tags that are processed. Applies to only non-IRIS loads. If it is used with -iris then all IRIS will be run an matching non-IRIS loads. 

     Switch   value    Description
 -iris            Run the code to keep all network dataless volumes from the DMC up to date and discover new ones.
 -noupdate        Do not update ANY databases - used to debug functions mainly.  No new IRIS network volumes, not last load dates, nothing).
 -where  regexp   Limit this run to loadurl whose tag names match this regular expression (Non -IRIS URL ONLY).
 -dbg              Increase the amount of logging.
